intro: Gomphrena decumbens var. roseiflora, commonly known as the roseflower bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and vibrant, rose-like bracts that give it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by colorful, papery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features include hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
